column2: The solution given by Socrates is as follows:--
column3: The solution given by Socrates is as follows:--

column2: Ion is confident that Socrates would never think him mad if he could only hear his embellishments of Homer.
column3: Ion is confident that Socrates would never think him mad if he could only hear his embellishments of Homer.

column2: Ion is compelled to admit that every man will judge of his own particular art better than the rhapsode.
column3: Ion is compelled to admit that every man will judge of his own particular art better than the rhapsode.
